div.p: I went to College and did BTEC in Performing Arts and then I went to University in Gloucestershire and did an HND in Performance in the Community
so that’s the training in dance and performing arts that I have. I’ve also done ABC Training which is a course put on by the Local Authority
and so I did that and obviously did Safeguarding training, Child Protection, you have to have a CRB check to make sure that, you know, you’re
above baord and First Aid training and also Food Hygiene so you can do cooking and things as well so and every couple of years new opportunities,
new training opportunities, come up because they like you to keep them, you know, up-to-date in case the legislation changes.
I’m slightly dyslexic so obviously when it’s theory-based that can be a bit of a struggle, you know obviously as well when people are reading out
things and stuff I’m a bit more reluctant to want to take part in that because obviously that makes me vulnerable and shows up, I guess,
one of my flaws so even though you’re training together people have different experiences of the same thing so it’s learning from others
really and networking, you get the opportunity to meet new people as well and obviously you can have a laugh...
You probably shouldn’t be having a laugh in training but I do sometimes...
